questions.title: When you eat out, do you order
When I think about sharing the Gospel, I am drawn to:
As a student, faith is important to
Which best describes your sense of God’s calling for your life?
What way of serving Jesus is most exciting to you?

results.summary: You are an explorer - seeking your place in the world.  You may not have been many places or tried many things, but you have the world open before you.

loveStudents.summary: You love students and those interested in learning. Being around them makes you happy and you can relate well to their place in life.

calling.summary: You are called to something special - and you know it. You are taking steps to explore and live into what you know - even now.

crossCulture.summary: You love crossing cultures to make a difference. You are willing to sacrifice and serve others in uncomfortable places and contexts.

loveStudents+calling.summary: You are called to help students find their way. You have a strong sense of who you are and what you were made for - and you love helping students discover that for themselves.

loveStudents+crossCulture.summary: You have a great combination of a love for different cultures and a great connection to students. The combination of those two things is where you shine.

calling+crossCulture.summary: You feel at home far from home and there are few who can do what you do there. You have special gifts that find their fulfillment far from the ordinary.

calling+crossCulture+loveStudents.summary: You are strong everywhere - in the paint, fast break, and from long range. Overseas student ministry is a place you feel strongly about and are excited to explore.
